column4: well why does "find / password.lst" fail when I can see the file????
try /etc/password
can you get to a terminal?  ctrl+alt+f1
yes
do you know how to restart the gdm?
login and then do the following
sudo service gdm restart
ok done and it takes me back to the gui login window
fine just login again.
ahh we'll have to do a bit more detective work -- what was the last thing you did before this problem occured?
tyring to get mythtv to install :-(
oh i can't help you there
what about del the file, is it , x11org.conf?
i wouldn't delete it, i'd rename it -- something like:  sudo mv x11org.conf x11org.conf.bkup
that should work
where is x11org kept?
this way you can see what's in the file, rather then just nuking it.
any idea where that file is?
curse this new keyboard - its /etc/X11/xorg.conf
tail var/log/messages?
i have never seen mythtv so sorry I can't help
I am not sure thats what killed it
that would be a could place to start, or you can simply do dmesg
not sure but isn't 443 used by samba?
